TopicTitle: RasterPropMonitor.dll is in the wrong place while it's not...

Articles.Content:
I've recently installed RasterPropMonitor to get ASET prop pack to work properly.

I've extracted the .zip into /KerbalSpaceProgram/GameData.

When I launch KSP however, I get an error message saying "Rasterpropmonitor.dll should be in GameData/JSI/RasterPropMonitor/Plugins but it's in GameData/". However, when I check, The .dll is in the right directory, and there's no RasterPropMonitor.dll in GameData/

How do I fix this?

 

EDIT: So I managed to fix it, turns out it was in /KerbalSpaceProgram/GameData/GameData... I have no idea why I have 2 GameData folders, but I fixed it now.

Edited August 14, 2019 by KevinTOC

Is it in

KerbalSpaceProgram/GameData/JSI/RasterPropMonitor/Plugins

or in

KerbalSpaceProgram/GameData/GameData/JSI/RasterPropMonitor/Plugins

In the latter case it should be pretty obvious what went wrong. Never blindly extract mods. Always check the contained folder structure first.

This used to be a huge problem for me. I just learned to always read the README.txt(rar) file included with the mod to make sure I had everything where it needed to be. 

Edited August 13, 2019 by Lo Var Lachland

23 hours ago, Harry Rhodan said:

Is it in

KerbalSpaceProgram/GameData/JSI/RasterPropMonitor/Plugins

or in

KerbalSpaceProgram/GameData/GameData/JSI/RasterPropMonitor/Plugins

In the latter case it should be pretty obvious what went wrong. Never blindly extract mods. Always check the contained folder structure first.

It was in KerbalSpaceProgram/GameData/GameData/JSI/RasterPropMonitor/Plugins... I just noticed that... I dunno why I have 2 GameData folders, but okay.

Edited August 14, 2019 by KevinTOC

4 hours ago, KevinTOC said:

I dunno why I have 2 GameData folders

Because you didn't look at the actual content of the zip file.
